qas.question: Most insects are able to perceive darkness and what else?
What insect is not abel to perceive light and dark?
Most insects have what kind of vision?
Insects notice what type of movement?
Many insects are able to see visible light, ultraviolet, and what other kind of light?

context: Most insects, except some species of <a1_0>cave crickets<a1_0/>, are able to perceive <a0_0>light<a0_0/> and dark. Many species have <a2_0>acute<a2_0/> vision capable of detecting <a3_0>minute<a3_0/> movements. The eyes may include simple eyes or ocelli as well as compound eyes of varying sizes. Many species are able to detect light in the <a4_0>infrared<a4_0/>, ultraviolet and the visible light wavelengths. Color vision has been demonstrated in many species and phylogenetic analysis suggests that UV-green-blue trichromacy existed from at least the Devonian period between 416 and 359 million years ago.
